channel.title: Getting a server to open and play
channel.description:
I need the following questions answered:
How do I get a client to open the game so I can play it? Are there any IP things I need to change in the server source thing?
If you have any other questions for getting info, just ask me.
EDIT: Using the source Projectscapev16 if it matters. Once I find out how to open my server, and play it, I should be able to get coding, because I understand that part :/

item.title: Getting a server to open and play
item.dc:creator: @usman555 usman555
item.description:
@usman555 wrote:

[quote=“Using me, post:5, topic:343042”][quote author=king gauge link=topic=439444.msg3229550#msg3229550 date=1275919809]
Well, check the GUI for the IP it should look something like this: server ip = "THE.IP.HERE"
[/quote]
Wheres the GUI? I can’t find it.

If that doesnt work, then open up the client and somewhere under the username/password area should be a place where the ip is located. The ip should be set to 0.0.0.0 until you are ready to run it. once you are ready to run your server, change the ip to what ever the server ip will be.

I don’t have a client, and I don’t know how to get one for my specific server. Do I download something, or is it in my server source or what?[/quote]
fail…
the gui.java is in the client file.

Read full topic
item.source: Getting a server to open and play

item.title: Getting a server to open and play
item.dc:creator: @Using_me Using me
item.description:
@Using_me wrote:

king gauge:

Well, check the GUI for the IP it should look something like this: server ip = "THE.IP.HERE"

Wheres the GUI? I can’t find it.

king gauge:

If that doesnt work, then open up the client and somewhere under the username/password area should be a place where the ip is located. The ip should be set to 0.0.0.0 until you are ready to run it. once you are ready to run your server, change the ip to what ever the server ip will be.

I don’t have a client, and I don’t know how to get one for my specific server. Do I download something, or is it in my server source or what?

Read full topic

item.title: Getting a server to open and play
item.dc:creator: @king_gauge king gauge
item.description:
@king_gauge wrote:

Well, check the GUI for the IP it should look something like this: server ip = "THE.IP.HERE"

If that doesnt work, then open up the client and somewhere under the username/password area should be a place where the ip is located. The ip should be set to 0.0.0.0 until you are ready to run it. once you are ready to run your server, change the ip to what ever the server ip will be.

item.title: Getting a server to open and play
item.dc:creator: @Using_me Using me
item.description:
@Using_me wrote:

aurocaido:

ok i don’t think you understand. because there is this thing called “run.bat” only one like it. It “runs” your server… if you can’t figure that out. then you shouldn’t even try coding. And no the ip should already be set at 127.0.0.1

No, I know that when I run the .bat, it puts up my server, but I still can’t figure out how to join it. But is there any way to change the IP and get a client that connects to that specific IP? When I see 127.0.0.1, is that basically the same as localhost? I want it so others can join.

Read full topic
item.source: Getting a server to open and play
